methodologyNotes: Complete brake system inspection and service. Front and rear brake pads replaced, brake fluid bled through all circuits, disc thickness measured and verified within tolerance.
technicalData:
Front brake pad thickness before: 8.2mm (limit: 3mm)
Front brake pad thickness after: 10.5mm
Rear brake pad thickness before: 6.1mm
Rear disc thickness: 24.8mm (min: 24.0mm)
Brake fluid: Dot 4 specification
Bleeding sequence: RR-LR-RF-LF
Torque specs: Caliper bolts 35Nm, Wheel bolts 110Nm
learnerProfile: Level 3 Motor Vehicle Service & Repair - Candidate 7290-701

tasks.description: Safely raised vehicle using jack and supported on axle stands
Removed wheels using wheel brace - stored safely
Measured existing brake pad thickness - front left: 8.2mm, front right: 8.4mm (both below 3mm limit)
Removed caliper bolts using socket set (35Nm specification)
Extracted old brake pads and inspected rotor for scoring or damage
Wound back caliper piston using brake wind-back tool to accommodate new thicker pads
Applied copper grease to caliper sliding surfaces to prevent sticking
Installed new brake pads (10.5mm thickness) and reinstalled caliper
Torqued caliper bolts to 35Nm specification
Measured rear brake pad thickness - left: 6.1mm, right: 6.3mm (acceptable but recommend replacement at next service)
Selected replacement rear pads matching OEM specifications
Removed rear caliper using appropriate socket sizes
Wound back rear caliper piston (drum brake type requires special tool)
Installed new rear brake pads with wear indicators
Reinstalled and torqued to specification
Located brake fluid reservoir and checked level (was at minimum)
Selected correct brake fluid (DOT 4) for system refill
Set up brake bleeding kit with clear tubing and collection jar
Started bleeding sequence at rear right wheel - opened bleed screw and pumped brake pedal
Continued through all four corners following correct sequence: RR-LR-RF-LF
Bled until clear fluid appeared with no air bubbles visible in tubing
Refilled reservoir to correct level and checked pedal feel - firm with no sponginess
Inspected front discs for scoring, cracks, or blue discoloration from overheating
Measured disc thickness using micrometer - front left: 24.8mm, front right: 24.9mm (minimum 24.0mm)
Checked disc run-out (wobble) - within acceptable tolerance
Inspected rear discs - light scoring visible but within limits
Recorded all measurements and findings in technical data section
Tested handbrake hold - would release after 3-4 clicks
Located handbrake cable adjuster under vehicle
Tightened cable adjuster to spec - handbrake now holds at 5-6 clicks
Verified rear brakes not engaged with lever fully released
